description: Dive into "Whispers of Romance in Amalfi's Embrace" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Romance in Amalfi's Embrace

places.generalDescription: Villa Rufolo is a 13th-century villa with Moorish influences, renowned for its stunning cascading gardens and terraces that offer breathtaking views of the sea. Over the years, it has become a significant tourist attraction, especially after hosting the first editions of Wagner's Concerts in its gardens. The Villa's international reputation grew further when it was acquired by the Provincial Tourist Board of Salerno and opened to the public.

sources.snippet: One of the most significant moments in Ravello‚Äôs history is the construction of its two most iconic villas, Villa Rufolo and Villa Cimbrone. The nobility of Ravello invited artists, scholars, and musicians to their courts, fostering an environment that attracted creative minds from across Europe.
sources.shortName: Ravello: The Most Romantic Place in the Amalfi Coast
Ravello | The Most Romantic Hilltop Town on the Amalfi Coast - Journal

places.name: Villa Rufolo

reviews.text:
Villa Rufolo
This place is absolutely breathtaking-truly beyond imagination. The views feel like something out of a movie. If you're visiting the Amalfi Coast, this is a must-see destination. However, keep in mind that driving there on your own can be challenging. The roads are narrow with very tight corners, so if you tend to get anxious while driving under pressure, I highly recommend joining a tour or hiring a driver to save yourself the stress of navigating and finding parking.

Villa Rufolo is a must - see hot spots destination for anyone visiting the Amalfi Coast.

A real hidden gem on the Amalfi Coast and one of my favorite place to see it.

This is nature's artwork on display .
A very impressive, stunning place with a unique color of the spirits, worth all the raves about it.

Worth spending a day here soaking in the ambience, surrounded by incredible scenery, pure natural peaceful, beautiful masterpieces of gardens and magnificent spectacular breathtaking views from every corner.

It's a truly enchanting and experience visiting this beautiful place

There is beauty around every bend.

Serenity in every view!!!

Simply breathtaking!!!

Main garden closed should be told when buying ticket, misleading. Gardeners walking around with cigarettes in the month just yapping. Supposed to be a peaceful place but just felt weird there. End of the season is coming so I understand but should have mentioned the main garden they use in all the pictures is closed and covered by a concert layout‚Ä¶ not worth ‚Ç¨7 entree for that‚Ä¶ but beautiful views that are normal in Ravello.

places.generalDescription: The Amalfi Coast is a UNESCO-listed landscape featuring small towns perched between mountains and the sea. A popular activity is the Classic Amalfi Coast walking tour, an 11-day journey along the Footpath of the Gods, offering unrivaled Italian coastal hiking. The self-guided walk allows exploration at a personalized pace through idyllic villages like Praiano, Positano, Sorrento, Amalfi, and Maestra dei Villaggi.

sources.snippet: The Amalfi Coast is full of charming romantic towns and villages. Amalfi, Positano, Praiano, Ravello, and Conca dei Marini are all fantastic places for a romantic getaway or honeymoon. But you could open a bottle of Rosati and argue the merits of a dozen other towns too.
sources.shortName: ‚ù§Ô∏è Romantic Hotels for a Honeymoon on the Amalfi Coast
10 Unforgettable Things to Do on the Amalfi Coast (+ Tips)

sources.snippet: A list of the most romantic places such as the Amalfi Coast, Sorrento, Napoli, the island of Capri, and Pompeii.
sources.shortName: Honeymoon in Campania: the most romantic places

places.name: Amalfi Coast

reviews.text:
Breathtaking and unforgettable!

The Amalfi Coast is truly one of the most stunning places you'll ever see-the views are absolutely postcard-perfect at every turn. Towering cliffs, sparkling turquoise waters, and picturesque villages make this destination something straight out of a dream.

I highly recommend visiting by coach if possible. The roads are incredibly narrow, winding, and steep, and while experienced drivers might manage, it's not for the faint-hearted! If you do decide to drive, go for a small car-a big vehicle would be a real challenge on those roads.

Beaches are beautiful but often require a walk down the cliffs, and some do charge for entry. It's worth it for the experience, though! The restaurants along the coast are wonderful-laid-back, welcoming, and happy to let you enjoy your meal without rushing you, which is refreshing in such a popular tourist spot.

Parking is expensive-around ‚Ç¨10 per hour-so if you're driving, plan to make the most of your time there.

Honestly, words don't do it justice-I'll let the pictures speak for themselves. A place you'll never forget!

Most beautiful place
One day trip it's enough but easily you can stay more
There is a lot of hotels
And beautiful places to see
And beaches
The road is beautiful
We took car that can open the roof
So the view was amazing.

The road is with a lot of curves so need to drive slowly
I recommend to take a small car it will be easier to maneuver.
there is difficult to find parking except the parking lots

Just drive along the road the pictures
Stop where you can
And enjoy

In the summer there is a lots of cars so prepare yourself üôèüòÄ

So far my favorite area / day excursion this trip. The small towns tucked into the hill sides all the way down to the pristine beaches. Exquisite. Don't let the "life style of the rich and famous" reputation run you off because the small towns are amazing and the locals even better.

places.generalDescription: Villa Cimbrone is an elegant hilltop lodging located in a medieval manor offering luxurious rooms, fine dining, and a pool. The hotel features nineteen suites set in large gardens, each uniquely decorated with stunning coastal views, fireplaces, marble floors, and frescoed ceilings. Guests can enjoy exquisite meals prepared by a Michelin star chef at the onsite restaurant and relax by the swimming pool in the central courtyard.

sources.snippet: While in Ravello, don‚Äôt miss the chance to stroll through the gardens of (8) Villa Cimbrone. At the very end of the garden you‚Äôll find the spectacular Terrace of Infinity. If you‚Äôre looking for an incredible spot to propose to your loved on the Amalfi Coast, this would be one of my top picks!
sources.shortName: Top 10 Romantic Spots on the Amalfi Coast

sources.snippet: Perched high above Ravello, Villa Cimbrone offers the ultimate romantic escape. From its breathtaking gardens to grand rooms with vaulted ceilings, it‚Äôs the perfect mix of luxury and romance, complete with a pool and Michelin-star dining.
sources.shortName: 19 of the Most Romantic Hotels on the Amalfi Coast, Italy (2025)

places.name: Villa Cimbrone

reviews.text:
We had the absolute pleasure of staying at Villa Cimbrone in Ravello for one of the most magical wedding celebrations imaginable-and it truly exceeded every expectation.

From the moment we arrived, the service was impeccable. The staff were exceptionally warm, welcoming, and professional, making the entire experience feel seamless and special. The hotel itself is a masterpiece-elegant, historic, and set within the breathtaking gardens of Ravello with sweeping views of the Amalfi Coast.

Our room was beautifully designed, spotlessly clean, and incredibly comfortable. The breakfast was another standout-an impressive variety of high-quality options, beautifully presented, and served with care in the most stunning surroundings.

Villa Cimbrone is not only a five-star hotel in every sense-it's also one of the most spectacular wedding venues we've ever experienced. The entire celebration was unforgettable, and Mark and Peter ensured everything was executed with such grace and professionalism.

Whether you're traveling as a couple, with family, or looking for the perfect wedding location, Villa Cimbrone is truly exceptional and comes highly, highly recommended.

as a tourist, 10‚Ç¨ ticket just for views and garden is not worth. the views can be seen directly from bus stop and near by easily accessible hiking points.
So the 10‚Ç¨ ticket price is not worth and give you a feeling of rip-off

This is one of my favourite hotels in the world. Sitting on top of a mountain, with stunning views of both the sea and other mountains for miles on end. Pictures don't do it justice, it has to be seen with your own eyes to be truly appreciated. Just be prepared for a short 10 minute hike with stairs to reach the hotel, since there are no direct roads accessible, but your luggage will be taken care of by the hotel porters. The walk to the hotel is a refreshing experience itself, giving you a taste of the Ravello mountain life!

The staff were all polite and professional, catering to our every need. We went for our wedding anniversary, and the staff accommodated us at every moment, even opening up their helipad for our pickup during departure.

Highly recommend this hotel for anyone looking to enjoy a peaceful escape far away from noise and people!

places.address: Via Santa Chiara, 26, 84010 Ravello SA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Valle delle Ferriere is a deep valley on the Amalfi coast, offering a unique break from the beaches. The trail starts in Pontone and ends in Amalfi, passing by ruins of medieval foundries and water mills that once powered the town's paper-making industry. This nature reserve provides a quiet escape from the bustling world, with two different routes available for hikers to explore.

sources.snippet: If you love hiking and nature, then spend a day exploring the (2) Valle delle Ferriere above Amalfi. As you hike into the valley above town, you‚Äôll pass ruins of old paper mills and follow a path along a crystal clear mountain stream. Don‚Äôt forget to pack a picnic to enjoy by the stream!.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Romantic Spots on the Amalfi Coast

places.name: Valle delle Ferriere

reviews.text:
We did the tour mid March, starting from Pontone. There is parking along the street which is cheap in the off-season from December till March. In the summer it's probably hard to get a spot here.

The hard parts of this route is the track from Amalfi to Pontone (1000 steps) and from Amalfi to the nature reserve (probably the nicer walk alongside the stream). We skipped those and went from Pontone straight to the nature reserve (45 minutes to the sign at the ruins, then 30 minutes to the reserve).

Unfortunately the reserve was closed. Maybe it's only open at the weekend in the off-season. If you follow the stream to the fence you can see the small waterfall anyway.

We really enjoyed the tour. It was quiet and peaceful and the nature was beautiful.

A must visit!!!
45 minutes hike away from Amalfi, the place is a time forgotten, intact, simply beautiful, and breathtaking.
Tingly recommended.

We started the Valle delle Ferriere hike right after arriving in Amalfi and it was such a great way to kick things off. If you're looking to get away from the busy town and enjoy some peace, nature, and amazing views, we totally recommend it. At one point we reached the Natura 2000 reserve, where there's a small ‚Ç¨5 entrance fee per person. After seeing some beautiful views, we continued toward Pontone and eventually made our way back to Amalfi. The hike was a bit tiring in places, but honestly, the scenery made it 100% worth it. A beautiful trail and a great adventure overall!

places.generalDescription: Pasticceria Pansa in Amalfi is a historic pastry shop and cafe that has been delighting visitors since 1830. This family-owned establishment, founded by Andrea Pansa, boasts five generations of proud leadership and was recognized as a historic landmark in 2001. The interior still retains its 19th-century decor and has welcomed storied clientele over the years.

sources.snippet: To take a break and indulge in local delights, visit the charming old Pasticceria Pansa, known for its legendary delizie al limone, creamy cakes flavoured with Amalfi lemons.
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Amalfi Coast Guide for Couples

places.name: Pasticceria Pansa Amalfi

reviews.text: You need to taste it at least once if you are at Amalfi! I'm not a fan of lemon cale but this little sweet ball is amazing! Perfect amount of lemon and so soft inside. Additionally, there's a whole range of sweets and treats inside the bakery so everyone will find something for them. Definately recommend!

Nice selection of sweets. The shop has a long history, founded in 1830, and is definitely worth a stop when in Amalfi. That said, given all the hype, we expected it to be more tasty-still a solid 4-star experience

Pansa Amalfi Caf√© is a lovely spot with truly delicious pastries and ice creams - some of the best we tried in Amalfi. The quality and presentation of the sweets definitely make it worth a visit.

The only downside was the drinks. Paying ‚Ç¨8 for a simple cup of tea or coffee didn't feel justified, though for the pastries it might be worth it. Still, it's a beautiful caf√© with great flavors and a must-try for the desserts.

places.generalDescription: Villa Cimbrone Gardens, located in Ravello, is a former farmhouse transformed into a luxurious palace and now a popular attraction. The gardens surrounding the villa are well-known for their rich landscaping and stunning views over cliffs and the Gulf of Salerno. The Terrace of the Infinite offers breathtaking panoramas of the coast and nearby villages. Visitors can explore the gardens, enjoy scenic views, and even visit a small caf√© with great gelato at the end.

sources.snippet: Don‚Äôt miss the opportunity to visit Villa Cimbrone, known for its breathtaking gardens overlooking the sea. Take a leisurely stroll through the grounds, admiring the lush landscapes, ancient statues, and elegant fountains. Book ahead to indulge in the innovative cuisine at Il Flauto di Pan, the hotel‚Äôs Michelin-starred restaurant.
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Amalfi Coast Guide for Couples

places.name: Terrazza dell'Infinito

reviews.text: I loved visiting Villa Cimbrone Gardens. The weather was also bright and sunny and it really made everything look fresh and romantic. They also provide you a leaflet so you can read about the pieces being there, all in all a great experience. The wind makes a beautiful sound through the trees, it's great to visit in spring.

Amazing place in the heart of charming Ravello. Villa Cimbrone offers a unique experience that stays with you long after your visit.
Perfect and stunning view to Amalfi Coast and Mediterranean sea. Lovely gardens and architecture and classic statues.

Truly one of the most breathtaking places on this planet. The villa, the gardens, and especially the view from the Infinity Terrace - absolutely unforgettable. A must-visit if you're anywhere near Ravello. Don't miss it.

places.address: Via Santa Chiara, 26, 84010 Ravello SA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Marina Grande is a renowned beachfront restaurant in Amalfi, offering traditional seafood dishes and a lounge bar with terrace seating. The area is the historic heart of the Amalfi Coast, attracting many visitors due to its central location and beautiful setting. During summer, Marina Grande beach becomes vibrant with colorful umbrellas and lively scenes. The pebbly beach offers stunning turquoise waters turning into deep blue hues.

sources.snippet: My favorite is the (3) Ristorante Marina Grande, which has a fabulous location overlooking Amalfi‚Äôs main beach. Family run and casually elegant, you‚Äôll enjoy a creative take on local dishes with the finest ingredients. It‚Äôs an excellent choice if you‚Äôre just passing through Amalfi and want a wonderful lunch or are staying in town and planning a romantic evening out.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Romantic Spots on the Amalfi Coast

places.name: Marina Grande

reviews.text:
Great location and views!

Great service! And the restaurant is very clean!

The staff is very friendly!

The place is a bit pricey but worth the price,  since everything was pomade to perfection!

95% of all the pasta dishes are with seafood, and they all taste delicious!

I would recommend!

Loved all experience. I took chefs tasting menu and it lasted for 2 hours.
Everything was great besides that server's look when I tipped 10 euro. The total bill was 155$. If you expect for a guest to tip more, you just have to add it to the guest's notice in menu or somewhere.
Since in Italy all tips are not expected and are optional. How I suppose to know how much I had to tip?
In the USA there is a certain percentage that a guest has to tip, because server's salary there is 2-2.50$/hour, so it's not like here and I'm sure not like at Michelin star restaurant pay.
Good luck

What is a Michelin Guide restaurant?
Is it a lifestyle? A sticker on the door? Or just an imaginary rating standard? If it's the latter, do we automatically start with 3‚Äì4 out of 5 points, or, on the contrary, do we judge with extra attention to detail?

Let's try to be rational, fair, and most importantly, sometimes rely on our own feelings.

To begin with-yes, I recommend this restaurant. There were three of us. Normally, you need a reservation here, but even though we didn't have one, and even though we arrived almost at closing time, they still kindly found us a table.

Every dish was delicious. Yes, yes, I know-a Michelin Guide restaurant that knows how to cook pasta. Shocking, right? You may ask-why come here? After all, you can get tasty pasta at a nearby place for two or even three times cheaper. So what's the difference? Here, every dish is a carefully designed creation. A painted composition. Every ingredient and spice complements the dish and creates a swirl of flavors, turning into something new. Something unique.
Food: 5/5

The restaurant sits right by the sea, with fresh flowers on each table and a warm, subtle glow of light that allows the sunset to take center stage.
Atmosphere: 5/5

The service was flawless-elegant table settings, prompt serving, genuinely attentive staff, and above all, a feeling of effortless comfort. They even let us carefully choose from all the teas available.
Overall service: 5/5

Of course, you can find elements of this elsewhere, but rarely brought to such perfection. If you still don't understand what a Michelin Guide restaurant really is-come here and see for yourself.

P.S. We came straight after swimming at the beach, so I left the cushion on my seat wet. Sorry for not mentioning it at the time!

places.address: Viale della Regione, 4, 84011 Amalfi SA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Torre dello Ziro, also known as the Ziro Tower, is a historic watchtower dating back to the 15th century. Originally built as a fortress to defend against pirate invasions along the Amalfi Coast, it now stands as a popular tourist attraction offering stunning panoramic views of the coastline. Perched on Mount Aureo, this ancient stone structure provides an ideal vantage point for admiring the beauty of the Gulf of Salerno and witnessing breathtaking sunsets during clear summer evenings.

sources.snippet: For beautiful views of Amalfi and the coastline at an easier pace, hike up to the 15th-century watchtower Torre dello Ziro high above Amalfi. The walk begins in Pontone, a hamlet of the quiet mountain town of Scala, and leads up to the tower where you‚Äôll enjoy views across the valley to Ravello and down to Atrani and Amalfi on the sea below.
sources.shortName: Where to Propose on the Amalfi Coast

places.name: Torre dello Ziro

reviews.text: So about google maps - yes, don't follow it. I'm putting a screenshot of komoot, a hiking app, leading to a great view up there, from which you can follow the signs and get to Torre. Once you're out of the city and on the stairs - follow the white-red markings and the road. It's an easy hike, but tiresome for there are a LOT of stairs. Still need to be in a good condition. As for the torre itself, I can't recommend going up. I did, yes, but stepped very carefully. I don't think this door is supposed to be open. The place needs some tightening, it seems it will collapse any second. The views are great even without going up the tower. I also recommend Belvedere, the view is even better, as it's higher. Visited in March, very pleasant. Not sure if google will keep them chronological in order though, but I hope you'll get some idea. Happy exploring!

As already mentioned by other's, do not follow Google maps for directions as it will take you to a completely different site. Love to go to the Torre dello Ziro, I grew up in the area and tend to walk up to it at every visit to Amalfi.
I walk from Amalfi side, up to Pontone, with an obligatory stop to the little town square bar for an espresso, just a tradition, than off to the Torre, I like to go to the ruderi first, than swing by the belvedere with an amazing panoramic view of the Amalfi coast and the Torre from high above it, and finally continue to the Torre. Again the views are amazing, you can enter the Torre and go to the top where there is a small platform to view Amalfi in full glory.
On the way back, I descended via Atrani to add even more beauty to the walk.
Be prepared to loads of steps, but well worth the awesome views.

The highlight of my Amalfi trip
Great views on the way up to the point.

Tough climb up because of the never ending stairs but it's fairly easy on the way down.
My calves are still burning!

Screenshot the map I used from another commenter, Google Maps is wrong.

places.address: Via Valle delle Ferriere, 36, 84010 Pontone SA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Babel Wine Bar Bistr√≤ & Art is a modern restaurant located on the Amalfi Coast, offering a serene escape with a casual and youthful vibe. The place prides itself on serving simple yet exceptionally well-prepared food, including stand-alone dishes and sharing platters of cured meats and cheeses paired with well-chosen Campania wines.

sources.snippet: Head to Babel for local wines and Italian tapas, indulge in an Aperol Spritz at the luxurious Palazzo Avino, or find an outdoor table at Luigi‚Äôs Bar. Settle in to drink & snack while the sun sinks in the sky.
sources.shortName: Ravello | The Most Romantic Hilltop Town on the Amalfi Coast - Journal

places.name: Babel wine bar bistr√≤ & art

reviews.text:
Huge Recommendation!!!!
The best pasta and the best service I've ever had. The staff is friendly and every dish is in decent size.
We took:
Green salad with orange, lemon, blue cheese and caramelized balsamic sauce.
Shrimp & calamari ravioli
Paste with porcini mushrooms.
Peach cheese cake dessert (a must)

Italian home cooking at its finest! We've visited a total of 5 times over our last 2 trips to Ravello and can't wait to return again. Some of our favorite dishes are Lasagna, lemon pasta, mushroom pasta, and meatballs. The desserts are also amazing. Thank you so much Nicola for your hospitality and incredible food!

Outstanding! We're already planning our return. The bruschetta and pasta dishes were absolutely delicious, the wines were fantastic, and our waiter's service was exceptional. I cannot recommend this place highly enough.

places.address: Via Santissima Trinit√†, 13, 84010 Ravello SA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Il Duoglio Spiaggia is a stunning beach located between Vietri sul Mare and Amalfi. It offers a larger version of Gavitella with beautiful sun exposure until early afternoon. Accessible by boat, the coast has private areas where you can rent sun beds and umbrellas or enjoy the public space with your own umbrella. The Lido degli Artisti restaurant provides friendly service and delicious beach food and drinks.

sources.snippet: Other fabulous options include Ravello‚Äôs Castiglione cliff-sheltered seaside district, laid-back Atrani beach and pristine Duoglio beach. And be sure to check out the minuscule Furore beach in, well, Furore. Known for its magnificent fjord and turquoise waters, it‚Äôs a tiny piece of paradise.
sources.shortName: The Ultimate Amalfi Coast Guide for Couples

places.name: Il Duoglio Spiaggia

reviews.text: We loved this beach so much that we went four times while in Amalfi. There are some negative reviews and limited information about this beach, which may deter some, but will try to clear up somethings. The beach is accessible by stairs or by boat from Amalfi. There are two businesses there that offer a restaurant/bar and beds/umbrellas. I Due Scugnizzi has pairs of beds ranging from approximately ‚Ç¨30-60, and the staff were very friendly-we got along with them well best price for cleanest prettiest beach. Lido Degli Artisti has more expensive beds. They also have a ‚Äòsit-down restaurant' section, but they require you to spend a minimum (more than the cost of a meal for two with drink for each). Overall, we had a great experience with the food and drinks at I Due Scugnizzi. On our last day, we got caught in a storm for an hour, and I Due Scugnizzi kindly invited the people at the free beach to take cover.

This beach was a true hidden gem during our trip along the Amalfi Coast. Il Duoglio Spiaggia is a small, peaceful beach tucked away from the crowds and noise, accessible either by a scenic staircase or by boat.

The water here is crystal clear - some of the clearest I've seen in Italy. The beach is pebbly, so I recommend bringing water shoes, but that only adds to its charm.

I suggest arriving early in the morning to enjoy the quiet atmosphere and find a good spot.

Great little beach! The sunbeds cost from 25 to 70 per person, depending on how far from the sea you decide :) You can order cocktails (15eur mostly) or food to your spot. The beach is pebbled , so shoes are a must:D There is a also a free beach spot, where you can chill without paying. Lovely! There are about 500 stairs to reach the beach, not as bad as it sounds:D but you can also take a boat there, but I don't know the prices as we braved the stairs:D. Muuuch better beach than the main one , it was never full, so you can enjoy it in peace. Went there for two days :)

places.address: Via Mauro Comite, 25, 84011 Amalfi SA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Spiaggia La Palombara is a serene and welcoming place, easily accessible on foot from Castellamare. It offers a spectacular sunset and can also be reached by bus or car, with both free and paid parking available. The beach provides a relaxing and amazing experience near the center of Castellammare before Vico Equense, boasting beautiful scenery that is a must-see in person.
places.name: Spiaggia La Palombara

reviews.text: Very beautiful scenery view that a must to see in person.
Free, clean beach. Parking was relatively easy to find. Apparently there were showers and changing rooms too, don't know if they cost something. A bit crowded, and very shallow water.
Relaxing and amazing Place near the center of Castellammare before Vico Equense

places.address: Via Sorrentina, 30, 80053 Castellammare di Stabia NA, Italy

places.generalDescription: Ristorante Santa Croce, originally a beach bar established in 1950, has evolved into a beloved restaurant serving traditional dishes to both vacationers and locals. Accessible only by sea from Amalfi, the restaurant offers a free transport service from Molo Darsena. The beach, named after an old chapel nearby, provides umbrellas, sun-loungers, and showers. Visitors praise the light and delicious food as well as the serene and private atmosphere of the beach.

sources.snippet: For a romantic and secluded day at the beach, my first choice is always the (1) Santa Croce Beach. This small, rocky beach is just a short boat ride west of Amalfi, and the boat ride there is part of the fun. We take the complimentary boat service provided by Ristorante Da Teresa and then settle in for a day under the orange umbrellas, only taking a break from the sun and swimming to enjoy a fabulous lunch overlooking the sea.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Romantic Spots on the Amalfi Coast

places.name: Santa Croce Restaurant e Beach Club Amalfi

reviews.text: Great little place tucked away on the Amalfi course. We had a large storm redirect our boat tour to this great little beach club and restaurant.  The staff was AMAZING and so kind and accommodating. Seafood is the name of the game and plenty of grilled seafood and gnocchi to fill our appetite.  Cocktails and Desert were fantastic.  Can't say enough about the service and staff.

Nice help with the buoy, and immediate transfer to the restaurant. We had to insist to get a table in the shade - the restaurant was busy and we did not have the chance to reserve upfront. The food was good, service friendly. Water is also nice for a swim. May be it is worthwile to make a booking upfront in high season. Overall we enjoyed our stop here during our daily boat trip/

Restaurant Santa Croce was AMAZING - including the staff, food, and location. We contacted the restaurant 48 hours before hosting a post-wedding event for 30 people in September 2024 and they jumped into action. (The location we originally booked never¬†confirmed and we had to scramble!) You would never know they organized last minute. The short boat ride from the main dock in Amalfi was coordinated for us and easy. The staff were welcoming ‚Äì including drinks as we got off the boats and snack baskets on the beach. After we swam and relaxed, the staff (with nonna!) prepared a delicious lunch with fresh ingredients including local specialities that included vegetables, fish, meat, pasta, dessert, and drinks. We returned to the beach after lunch and enjoyed the sun, water, and additional beverages before heading back to Amalfi. We highly recommend Restaurant Santa Croce!

places.address: Spiaggia, Via Santa Croce, 1, 84011 Amalfi SA, Italy

places.generalDescription: The Duomo of Saint Mary of the Assumption, also known as the Ravello Cathedral, is a historic church with a rich heritage. Built in 1086 by order of the first Ravello bishop, Orso Papirio, it boasts unique decorative features including mosaics and sculptures.

sources.snippet: Piazza Centrale is Ravello‚Äôs main square, a charming gathering place with the Duomo, cafes, shops, and restaurants. It‚Äôs a perfect spot for a leisurely stroll with your loved one.
sources.shortName: Ravello: The Most Romantic Place in the Amalfi Coast

places.name: Duomo di ravello

reviews.text:
The Duomo of Saint Mary of the Assumption in Ravello is an absolutely stunning backdrop for a wedding photoshoot. I had the privilege of capturing magical moments in front of its historic facade, surrounded by the charm and elegance of Ravello's timeless beauty. This location, with its rich history and breathtaking views, adds a touch of romance and grandeur to any celebration.

If you're planning your dream wedding in Ravello, this is a must-visit spot-and don't forget to have a photographer who can bring these moments to life. Highly recommend this iconic destination!

The Duomo of Saint Mary is a decent cathedral, but it definitely fell short of my expectations. The cathedral area was pretty large and had some unique character. However, the walls were mostly white with little artwork. There was also a museum with old empty sarcophaguses, church artifacts, and sculptures dating back to the 13th century. It was a good experience, but it didn't blow me away. If you're in the area, I would recommend going to the nearby Amalfi Cathedral instead. It's the same price (4 euros) and it blows this cathedral away in size and ornateness.
The duomo of Ravello is quite beautiful, yet the least interesting sight in the village. The most important part are the mosaic covered pulpits inside.
